intro: Buseria, commonly known as the Indian borage, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Buseria is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in herbal medicine. Its growth habit and floral structure make it a distinctive member of its family.
